a.a: s89 a “interjection for displeasure, contradiction, surprise, disappointment, or pity and (dialectal) interjection for emphasis” < s8 *ā “interjection that expresses various emotions”

abece.a: s89 abece “alphabet” < a combination of the name of the first three letters in Turkish alphabet; s89 a “alpha”, s89 be “beta” and s89 ce “gamma”.

abımak.a: s31 -آبیٖ “to cover up” (Mahmud al-Kashgari, Dīwān Lughāt al-Turk) < s8 *apï- < s8 *ap- “(onom.) to close” + s8 *+ï- “emphasis suffix”.

acıkmak.a:
s89 acık- “(intransitive) to hunger; be hungry, feel hunger, feel peckish” < s71 آجیق “to be hungry, to hunger” < s8 *āčïk- < s8 *āč- “to hunger” (or another possibility s8 *āč “hunger”) + s8 *+ïk- “a suffix for verbs and nouns; makes reflexive and intransitive verbs”

Besides, s8 *āč- ≈ s8 *āč and the phrases /č/ and /č-/ point to a common root of unknown nature; s8 *ā-

See ağ.

anlamak.a:
s89 anla- “to understand, to comprehend, to get” < s71 -آكلا < s8 *aŋla- < s8 *aŋ “” + s8 *+la- <

See aç.

ağ.a: s89 ağ “a mesh of string, cord or rope” and besides “the silken structure which a spider builds using silk secreted from the spinnerets at the caudal tip of its abdomen; a spiderweb” < s8 *āg “trap; usually used for hunting” < it is certain that this word is cognate with s8 *āb “hunt, chase” (≈ sand s8 *āŋ “wild animal”

ağırmak.a:
s89 ağır- “to shout (shout loudly); bağırmak” < s71 -آغر “to bray in an ugly voice; anırmak” < s71 -قر+ “suffix for onomatopoeias and interjections” + s71 آ “an interjection”

See a.

iz.a:
t1 iz < p1 *i- p1 +rʲ

Besides, p1 i- < p1 ið-

belirmek.a:
t1 belir- “to appear” < o1 بلرمك < p1 *bẹl- “to keep in mind” + p1 *+gür- < p1 *bẹ “i” + p1 *+l-²

See bilmek.

bilmek.a:
t1 bil- “to know, understand, recognise” < p1 *bil- “to know” < p1 *bi “this” + p1 *+l-³

See bu.

bulmak.a:
t1 bul- “to find, discover, invent, reach” < p1 *bul- “to find” < p1 *bu “this” + p1 *+l-³

See bu.

sarı.a:
t1 sarı “yellow” ≈ g1 sarı < o1 صاری ≈ c1 шурӑ < p1 *sarïg “yellow, white” < p1 *sarï- “to become yellowish white” + p1 *+g

Besides, p1 *sarïg > p2 *siro “white”, p3 *sïra “yellow”

Besides, p1 *sarï- < p1 *saŕ “egg membrane” p1 *+ï-

See sarmak.

kızıl.a:
t1 kızıl “bright red, scarlet” ≈ g1 kızıl < o1 صاری ≈ c1 хӗрлӗ < p1 *kï̄zgïl “red” < p1 *kï̄zïg “redness” + p1 *+ïl2

Besides, p1 *kï̄zïg < p1 *kï̄z- “to be hot, glow, redden” + p1 *+ïg

See kızarmak.

diz.a:
09 diz “knee” < 6 دیز 6 * “joint” < ptr *tī- “to straighten” + ptr *+ŕ

Besides, ptr *tī- < ppt *tīḏ- “to set”

diri.a:
09 diri “alive” < ptr *tīrig < ptr *tīri- “to live” + ptr *+g

See dirilmek.

dirilmek.a:
09 diril- “to come alive” < ota -دیرل ≈ otk -𐱅𐰃𐰼𐰠 < ptr *tīri- + ptr
*+i-

Besides, ptr *tīri- “to stand, arise” < ptr *tīŕ “joint” + ptr *+i-

See diz.

dirsek.a:
s89 dirsek “elbow” < s8 *tirsgek < s8 *tīrse- “to joint” + s8 *+gek

Besides, tuk tirse- “to turn, curl” < ptr *tīrse- < s8 *tīŕ “joint” + s8 *+se-

See diz.

dik.a:
tur dik “upright, vertical” < ota دیك < ptr *tīk < ptr *tī- “set up” + ptr *+k

See dikmek.

dizmek.a:
tur diz- “to line up” < ota -ديز ≈ otk -𐱅𐰃𐰼𐰠 < ptr *tīŕ- “to bead, string; arrange in a row” < ptr *tī- + ptr +ŕ-

See diz.

diremek.a:
s89 dire- “to resist, hold up, persist” < ota -ديز ≈ otk -𐱅𐰃𐰼𐰠 < *tīrig + ptr *+a- mahiyeti seviyorum

See diri. mahiyeti seviyorum

dirlik.a:
s89 dirlik‎ harmealth, life” < ota < oat tirlik < oat tiril- oat +k

See dirilmek.

dikmek.a:
s89 dik- “to erect, to plant” < s71 -دیك ≈ s69 -𐱅𐰃𐰚 < ptr *tīk- < ptr *tī- “set up” + ptr *+k-

See diz.

ayak diremek.a:
s89 ayak dire- “persist in”

See ayak, diremek.

ayak.a:
s89 ayak “foot” < s71 آیاق ≈ s69 𐰑𐰴 < s8 *aḏak < s8 *aḏgak < s8 *aḏ- “to separate” + s8 *+gak

See ayırmak.

ayırmak.a: s89 ayır- “to part; separate, choose, pick, select, distinguish” < s71 -آیر < s8 aḏïr- < s8 *aḏ- “to separate” + s8 *+ïr-
